data.title: Number conversion
data.statement:
You must <<convert>> the number given in scientific notation into {{Million}}, {{Billion}}, {{Trillion}}, {{Quadrillion}}, {{Quintillion}}, {{Sextillion}}, {{Septillion}} or {{Octillion}} and <<round>> it to the thousandth. 
Consider {{Million}}, {{Billion}}, {{Trillion}}, {{Quadrillion}}, {{Quintillion}}, {{Sextillion}}, {{Septillion}} and {{Octillion}} as units.

If given number is under 1 million, just return value as float. No rounding to the thousand is requiered if the given number is under 1 million.

1 {{Million}} = 1e6 = 10^6
1 {{Billion}} = 1e9 = 10^9
1 {{Trillion}} = 1e12 = 10^12
1 {{Quadrillion}} = 1e15 = 10^15
1 {{Quintillion}} = 1e18 = 10^18
1 {{Sextillion}} = 1e21 = 10^21
1 {{Septillion}} = 1e24 = 10^24
1 {{Octillion}} = 1e27 = 10^27
data.inputDescription:
A string [[n]], containing a number in scientific notation.

[[value]]e[[exponent]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must convert the number given in scientific notation into Million, Billion, Trillion, Quadrillion, Quintillion, Sextillion, Septillion or Octillion and round it to the thousandth.
Consider Million, Billion, Trillion, Quadrillion, Quintillion, Sextillion, Septillion and Octillion as units.

If given number is under 1 million, just return value as float. No rounding to the thousand is requiered if the given number is under 1 million.

1 Million = 1e6 = 10^6
1 Billion = 1e9 = 10^9
1 Trillion = 1e12 = 10^12
1 Quadrillion = 1e15 = 10^15
1 Quintillion = 1e18 = 10^18
1 Sextillion = 1e21 = 10^21
1 Septillion = 1e24 = 10^24
1 Octillion = 1e27 = 10^27
Input
A string n, containing a number in scientific notation.

valueeexponent
Output
A string, containing the converted number followed by its value.

value unit

Value must be float
Constraints
1e0 < n < 1e30
Example
Input
1.23456789e8
Output
123.457 Million
